jobs.title: Software Developer, Desktop Apps (Remote Option)
jobs.description:
COMPANY

AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, Pennsylvania; a severe weather center in Wichita, Kansas; and offices in New York City and... elsewhere around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their activities and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as AccuWeather For Business (AFB), radio, television, newspapers, digital out of home, the 24/7 AccuWeather Network channel and AccuWeather NOW streaming service. Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites.

AccuWeather's innovation-first promise has led to the development of many award-winning and propriety features that are available free to the public, including AccuWeather MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy ™, the exclusive AccuWeather RealFeel® Temperature, and AccuWeather RealImpact™ Scale for Hurricanes, among many other revolutionary products for the greater safety, convenience and comfort of our users. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of the Fortune 500 and thousands of other businesses in the U.S. and globally.

Dr. Joel N. Myers, Founder and Chief Executive Officer, established AccuWeather in 1962 and is considered the “father of modern commercial meteorology.” Dr. Myers, a leading creative thinker and visionary, has been named “the most accurate man in weather” by The New York Times and one of the top entrepreneurs in American history by Entrepreneur’s Encyclopedia of Entrepreneurs.

SUMMARY

The Software Developer of Desktop Apps will be responsible for the developing and maintaining the AccuWeather for Business forecasting desktop application and associated integrations. Leveraging modern technologies and architectural approaches, you will translate forecasting and meteorological needs into world class production code.

This position will work cross-functionally with Forecasting, Development, Product and other groups, in an Agile-based development environment, to deliver both real-time data and best of breed experiences that cater to a global audience.

Remote candidates are being considered for this mid-level opportunity.

RESPONSIBILITIES

• Develop functional, efficient, and well-structured code, and test artifacts
• Work closely with design teams to graduate mockups to functional interfaces/features
• Leverage client and server-side technologies to build modern components for desktop applications
• Work closely with Forecasting, Product, and Design to develop innovative user experiences
• Prototype, test, and iterate upon new features

QUALIFICATIONS

• BS/BA in related discipline with 3+ years’ experience in related field
• Proficient in modern programming languages such as C++, Google Go, C#, and Java
• Proficient in modern scripting languages such as CSS and JavaScript
• Proficient in Geographic Information Systems (GIS) such as Esri, MapBox, and Leaflet
• Self-driven; good problem-solving skills; adaptable and willing to take ownership
• Good verbal and written communication and collaboration skills
• Experience building desktop applications (C++, SQL, Google Go) and desktop UI (Qt framework)
• Experience with hardware accelerated rendering (OpenGL)
• Demonstrates critical thinking and analysis in bringing successful resolution to small-to-moderate projects
• Experience with version control systems and CI/CD processes (Git, Mercurial, SVN – Jenkins, Azure DevOps, etc.)
• Understanding of unit testing frameworks and tools
• Understanding of security principles, standards, and conventions
• In the United States, AccuWeather is only able to hire team members in the following states due to taxation purposes: CA, CO, CT, DE, DC, FL, GA, IL, IN, KS, KY, MD, MN, MO, NE, NV, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OK, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, VA, WA, WI and WY.

AccuWeather is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity to all applicants and existing employees and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity/expression), sexual orientation, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, marital status, political affiliation, religion, citizenship status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other basis protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. View the EEO is the Law poster here and its supplement here. The pay transparency policy is available here.

AccuWeather is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to human.resources@accuweather.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information

jobs.title: Desktop, Applications
jobs.description:
We are looking for a Desktop Application and Mobile Support Manager for our client located in New York City.

Note: Selected individual should have previous experience working in a law firm or in a legal department...

This is a Direct Hire position, with great salary and benefits (up to 175k)

This position will be remote until Jan 2022 and then will require you to work onsite 100% in New York City

Looking for Candidates that live in a Commutable Distance to New York City

Please email your resume in a WORD doc to [Email available when viewing the job]

The Desktop, Application and Mobile Support Manager is responsible for managing and overseeing all technology operations for the Desktop, Applications, Mobility and Conferencing Technology Services teams, with focus on high level customer service, responsiveness to business needs and devising and establishing IT policies to support the needs of the firm.

Desktop & Mobility Services - deploys and supports all end points, 2nd level support for all applications, mobile device configuration and remote access support.

Conferencing Technology - design, implementation and delivery of all conference room technology, audio, video and web conferencing setup and support.

Ability to work independently and ensure availability at all times in a customer centric, high service level and continually evolving environment.

Work closely with Help Desk Manager to manage escalations and tickets.

Reporting Structure:

The Desktop, Application, and Mobile Support Manager will report directly to the Director of User Support and Education

Principal Duties and Responsibilities
• Planning, execution and support of end points and conference technology deployments for the firm.
• Maintain the highest level of customer support for the customer base through proactive management and implementation of continuous improvement initiatives; provide high-touch white-glove service
• Provide technical and business leadership, mentorship and support to the team.
• Oversee operations of second level escalations by creating a business focused and responsive environment for quick turnaround and resolution.
• Act as a key interface to the Desktop & Mobility Services, Conferencing Technology Services, Infrastructure, Applications development and other departments throughout the firm.
• Work effectively, efficiently and collaboratively with others throughout IS and the firm to deliver the objectives of the department and the firm.
• Formulate performance plans and provide regular feedback throughout the year to direct reports.
• Oversee and guide professional development and coaching for team members with an emphasis on acquiring soft skills and business focus in addition to technical knowledge.
• Metrics and Reporting - Responsible for reporting on groups KPIs. Develops process for regular metric analysis and reporting. Review performance metrics with leadership and stakeholders. Makes recommendations for performance improvement based on metric data.
• Process Improvement Regularly reviews support processes and works to streamline and automate where applicable. Seeks to expand overall services provided to users and looks for opportunities to shift routine work from other technology teams to the desktop support team when possible. Responsible for the IT Service Management (ITSM) tools, including implementation and automation of service and support processes'.
• Knowledge Management - Ensures that knowledge is captured in the appropriate context, is accurate and published timely for use within the Desktop Support team and other operational teams with a focus on improving service delivery to customers. Coaches Desktop Support Team on the knowledge management workflow. Works with second and third level teams and facilitates appropriate knowledge capture and training.

Position Specific Skills and Requirements
• Bachelor's degree, and/or a minimum of three year's managerial level experience in related systems support preferably in a law firm environment.
• ITIL service delivery qualification foundation level preferred.

Education and General Requirements
• Attributes expected of all candidates include: responsibility, honesty, reliability, initiative, patience, attention to detail, determination, taking pride in one's work, and a desire to learn.
• Interpersonal skills necessary to interact and work productively as part of the Information Systems team, delivering high quality services to the Firm and our clients.
• Ability to meet deadlines and effectively complete operational and project based assignments.
• Ability to communicate effectively, in person and in writing, with Firm personnel at all levels and outside parties as necessary.
• Ability to work independently.
• Attendance Requirements:
• On site during normal working hours and available as necessary before or after normal working hours to work at the Firm, over the telephone, or at off-site meetings, in order to meet the demands of the job and the needs of the Firm.
• Expected to carry a wireless email device and respond when necessary

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Desktop Developer Experience - Slack
jobs.description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category...
Products and Technology

Job Details
About the Team

The Slack Internal Tools team makes the development and release of new code safe and enjoyable for our developers. We maintain Slack's deploy pipeline, continuous integration infrastructure, and code review process.

The Desktop DevXP team is part of the Slack Internal Tools team. This team builds tools to ensure that desktop engineers at Slack can develop, test and deploy high-quality code safely and at scale. Our work is to make the Desktop Development team more productive. We’re infrastructure engineers who value craftsmanship, quality and empathy.

Software Engineers at Slack work in a highly collaborative environment, and that is particularly true within Developer Productivity where we are focused on improving the working lives of our fellow engineers across the company. One size does not fit all so please bring your bag of tricks and ability to teach them to others.

Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?

What you will be doing
• Understand desktop releases and infrastructure
• Translate new requirements into designs that align with team and company goals.
• Evaluate, implement, and maintain high-quality tools and automation processes to support continuous delivery and developer productivity.

What you should have
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience
• 2+ years of relevant experience.
• Firm grasp of computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval
• You are a team player and get motivated by helping other engineers succeed. When things break — and they will — you are eager and able to help fix things. You like thinking of ways to improve efficiency or bring delight to the people you work with
• You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you
• You listen to your mentor and senior engineer, provide your input and move fast
• You are a quick learner, and able to learn and apply best practices for unit tests, code review, design documentation, debugging, and troubleshooting quickly
• You are someone that others enjoy working with due to your positive attitude and technical competence
• You have curiosity about how things work
• You can work with whichever programming language is required to get the job done—Python, PHP, TypeScript, or others—and are proficient in at least one.

Preferred Qualifications
• You have good knowledge with git version control system and Github APIs
• You are familiar with CI/CD system such as Circleci or Jenkins
• You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
• You have experience with administration of different operating systems including MacOS, Linux and Windows
• You have experience with cross platform desktop application release process
• You have experience with application error tracking and analysis tool such as Sentry or Bugsnag
• You've used Slack and are excited to make it better.

Slack is registered as an employer in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Slack is registered, you will not be eligible for employment.Visa sponsorship may not be available in certain remote locations.

Visa sponsorship is not available for candidates living outside the country of this position.

For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $121,000. You may also be entitled to receive incentive compensation: bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.

jobs.title: Ubuntu Desktop Software Engineer
jobs.description:
The Ubuntu Desktop Team is responsible for delivering Ubuntu Desktop, which is one of the most popular Linux operating systems available for desktops today. Ubuntu strives to be the best free software operating system in existence. Along with delivering Ubuntu Desktop, the team is also charged with leading the way in the application ecosystem necessary for external app developers to bring high... quality applications to the Linux desktop.

We are seeking a Software Engineer to join the Ubuntu Desktop Team to build the best open source operating system in the world. Candidates should have engineering experience with two or more of Ubuntu Desktop, Flutter, Dart, GNOME, GTK, Python, Go, C, Debian or Snap packaging.

• Write high quality code to create new features

Who you are
• You love technology and working with brilliant people

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Desktop - Slack
jobs.description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category...

Products and Technology

Job Details

The team behind Slack's Desktop Application is looking for a Senior Engineer to join us in building one of the most heavily used pieces of software in the world.

As a team member, you'll be strategizing, designing and building solutions that lie at the heart of Slack's most used client. You and the team are responsible for a critical layer of infrastructure between Electron – the open source framework that powers our app – and the frontend of Slack. Your work will empower the tens of millions of people that rely on Slack every day. You'll focus on bringing the latest native capabilities to our platform, ensuring consistent integration with the OS, and laying a high-performing foundation for frontend engineers throughout the organization.

What You Will Be Doing:
• Designing and implementing well-tested, scalable, and high performance code impacting millions of users every day.
• Fixing technical inefficiencies within our code and architecture.
• Evaluating and implementing new technologies to improve performance and stability across the desktop ecosystem.
• Part of the team that owns the Desktop application infrastructure, leading its long-term health and expanding on its underlying systems.
• Assisting our skilled support team and operations team to triage and resolve production issues.

What You Should Have:
• Strong understanding of TypeScript or JavaScript and in depth knowledge of the web ecosystem.
• You have worked on Electron-based applications.
• Experience building web or native applications.
• Understanding of frameworks like React and Redux.
• Comfort with the shell and a variety of operating systems.
• The ability to model standard methodologies for unit tests, code review, design documentation, debugging, and troubleshooting
• Strong interpersonal skills, e.g. ability to convey complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers
• Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset.

Bonus points If You Have:
• You've worked on a native desktop app before and have a strong understanding of the internals of Windows, MacOS or Linux
• You've written Objective-C or C++ integrating with native APIs
• You've used Slack and are excited to make it better for millions of users

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Desktop Apps
jobs.description:
The Desktop Applications team is developing Smartsheet solutions that enable customers to experience Smartsheet as a desktop application on Mac and Windows environments. Our engineering teams are small, efficient, and driven by results. We work in an Agile environment that stays focused on building great software and solutions. Smartsheet is a place where people love what they do and are... empowered to make an impact everyday. We support one another and achieve our goals as a team, not as individuals.

Our team rewards ownership, transparency, and collaboration. You will report to an Engineering leader based from our Bellevue, WA office and will have the option to work remotely from any Smartsheet registered location within the United States. Learn more about Smartsheet platform here: Smartsheet Overview Video

You will:
• Participate in the entire development life cycle, from concept to release
• Implement new features and improve the ones we have already built
• Write clean and efficient code based on product specifications and participate in all phases of quality assurance and defect resolution
• Develop and maintain CI/CD pipeline implementations
• Work closely with other software engineers, partner teams, SRE, and product managers

You have:
• 5+ years for Sr Engineers software development experience
• Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, deployment, testing, operations, and monitoring
• Experience building scalable back-end services
• Experience building REST based APIs
• Legally eligible to work in the U.S. on an ongoing basis
• BS or MS in Computer Science, a related field, equivalent industry experience, or equivalent educational experience.
• HSA, 100% employer-paid premiums, or Buy-up medical/vision and dental coverage options for full-time employees
• Equity - Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) with all offers
• Lucrative Employee Stock Purchase Program (15% discount)
• 401k Match to help you save for your future (50% of your contribution up to the first 6% of your eligible pay)
• Monthly stipend to support your work and productivity
• Up to 24 weeks of Parental Leave
• Personal paid Volunteer Day to support our community
• Opportunities for professional growth and development including access to LinkedIn Learning online courses
• Company Funded Perks, including a counseling membership, primary care membership, local retail discounts, and your own personal Smartsheet account
• Teleworking options from any registered location in the U.S. (role specific)

Equal Opportunity Employer:

Smartsheet is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to fostering an inclusive environment with the best employees. We provide employment opportunities without regard to any legally protected status in accordance with applicable laws in the US, UK, and Australia. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

At Smartsheet, we strive to build an inclusive environment that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our team members who also represent the diverse needs of our customers. We're looking for people who are driven, authentic, supportive, effective, and honest. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match our job description-if your career path has been nontraditional, that will set you apart. At Smartsheet, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who aren't afraid to be innovative-join us

You will:
• Participate in the entire development life cycle, from concept to release
• Implement new features and improve the ones we have already built
• Write clean and efficient code based on product specifications and participate in all phases of quality assurance and defect resolution
• Develop and maintain CI/CD pipeline implementations
• Work closely with other software engineers, partner teams, SRE, and product managers

You have:

• Experience building scalable back-end services
• Experience building REST based APIs
• Legally eligible to work in the U.S. on an ongoing basis
• BS or MS in Computer Science, a related field, equivalent industry experience, or equivalent educational experience.
• HSA, 100% employer-paid premiums, or Buy-up medical/vision and dental coverage options for full-time employees

• Opportunities for professional growth and development including access to LinkedIn Learning online courses

• Teleworking options from any registered location in the U.S. (role specific)

jobs.title: Desktop, Applications
jobs.description:
We are looking for a Desktop Application and Mobile Support Manager for our client located in New York City.

Note: Selected individual should have previous experience working in a law firm or in a legal department...

This is a Direct Hire position, with great salary and benefits (up to 175k)

This position will be remote until Jan 2022 and then will require you to work onsite 100% in New York City

Looking for Candidates that live in a Commutable Distance to New York City

Please email your resume in a WORD doc to [Email available when viewing the job]

The Desktop, Application and Mobile Support Manager is responsible for managing and overseeing all technology operations for the Desktop, Applications, Mobility and Conferencing Technology Services teams, with focus on high level customer service, responsiveness to business needs and devising and establishing IT policies to support the needs of the firm.

Desktop & Mobility Services - deploys and supports all end points, 2nd level support for all applications, mobile device configuration and remote access support.

Conferencing Technology - design, implementation and delivery of all conference room technology, audio, video and web conferencing setup and support.

Ability to work independently and ensure availability at all times in a customer centric, high service level and continually evolving environment.

Work closely with Help Desk Manager to manage escalations and tickets.

Reporting Structure:

The Desktop, Application, and Mobile Support Manager will report directly to the Director of User Support and Education

Principal Duties and Responsibilities
• Planning, execution and support of end points and conference technology deployments for the firm.
• Maintain the highest level of customer support for the customer base through proactive management and implementation of continuous improvement initiatives; provide high-touch white-glove service
• Provide technical and business leadership, mentorship and support to the team.
• Oversee operations of second level escalations by creating a business focused and responsive environment for quick turnaround and resolution.
• Act as a key interface to the Desktop & Mobility Services, Conferencing Technology Services, Infrastructure, Applications development and other departments throughout the firm.
• Work effectively, efficiently and collaboratively with others throughout IS and the firm to deliver the objectives of the department and the firm.
• Formulate performance plans and provide regular feedback throughout the year to direct reports.
• Oversee and guide professional development and coaching for team members with an emphasis on acquiring soft skills and business focus in addition to technical knowledge.
• Metrics and Reporting - Responsible for reporting on groups KPIs. Develops process for regular metric analysis and reporting. Review performance metrics with leadership and stakeholders. Makes recommendations for performance improvement based on metric data.
• Process Improvement Regularly reviews support processes and works to streamline and automate where applicable. Seeks to expand overall services provided to users and looks for opportunities to shift routine work from other technology teams to the desktop support team when possible. Responsible for the IT Service Management (ITSM) tools, including implementation and automation of service and support processes'.
• Knowledge Management - Ensures that knowledge is captured in the appropriate context, is accurate and published timely for use within the Desktop Support team and other operational teams with a focus on improving service delivery to customers. Coaches Desktop Support Team on the knowledge management workflow. Works with second and third level teams and facilitates appropriate knowledge capture and training.

Position Specific Skills and Requirements
• Bachelor's degree, and/or a minimum of three year's managerial level experience in related systems support preferably in a law firm environment.
• ITIL service delivery qualification foundation level preferred.

Education and General Requirements
• Attributes expected of all candidates include: responsibility, honesty, reliability, initiative, patience, attention to detail, determination, taking pride in one's work, and a desire to learn.
• Interpersonal skills necessary to interact and work productively as part of the Information Systems team, delivering high quality services to the Firm and our clients.
• Ability to meet deadlines and effectively complete operational and project based assignments.
• Ability to communicate effectively, in person and in writing, with Firm personnel at all levels and outside parties as necessary.
• Ability to work independently.
• Attendance Requirements:
• On site during normal working hours and available as necessary before or after normal working hours to work at the Firm, over the telephone, or at off-site meetings, in order to meet the demands of the job and the needs of the Firm.
• Expected to carry a wireless email device and respond when necessary

jobs.title: Ubuntu Desktop Software Engineer
jobs.description:
The Ubuntu Desktop Team is responsible for delivering Ubuntu Desktop, which is one of the most popular Linux operating systems available for desktops today. Ubuntu strives to be the best free software operating system in existence. Along with delivering Ubuntu Desktop, the team is also charged with leading the way in the application ecosystem necessary for external app developers to bring high... quality applications to the Linux desktop.

• Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
• Write high quality code to create new features

Who you are
• You love technology and working with brilliant people
• You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
• You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
• You have a Bachelor’s or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree

jobs.title: REMOTE Sr. Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Job Title: Sr. Software Engineer - Desktop Application

Location: REMOTE...

Salary: $130-170K+ DOE

Requirements: Java, Desktop Applications, Hibernate, Spring, MySQL

As a leader in manufacturing and WMS software offerings to small and mid-size organizations, we are rapidly growing, both on-site, hybrid on-site, and remotely.

We are adding bright and motivated individuals to our team across our three products. Desktop Application, Web Application, and Service-Oriented Product on AWS. So if you have Java development and experience in one of these areas, let's talk

What You Will Be Doing

As a Sr. Software Engineer working on our Java-based client/server desktop application, you will be directly involved in architecture, development, and delivery of products, applying your experience building desktop application software and collaborating with others to drive agile development processes throughout your team.

Responsibilities
• Work within a team of Software Engineers, onshore and potentially offshore, focusing on producing and delivering products.
• Build our flagship desktop product: Java-based client/server application running in thousands of our customers' warehouses and within our own application-hosting environment.
• Apply agile development practices, working closely with your team to rapidly deliver high-value features.
• Support and adhere to coding and unit test standards applied by the team. Always be a driver of the highest quality products.
• Work within the team to address and resolve escalated production issues in a timely manner, participating in postmortems and root cause analysis and assisting to identify and implement mitigation strategies based on what was learned.
• Mentor and share knowledge with other engineers to lift the team and products.

What You Need for this Position

Qualifications
• BS Degree
• 3-5+ years' Java Development
• Experience building desktop applications/java-based client/server apps
• Java, Hibernate, Spring, MySQL

Bonus
• Manufacturing, WMS, ERP, Inventory, or similar

What's In It for You
• Competitive Compensation (130-170K+ DOE)
• Vacation/PTO - 15 Days, increasing to 20 at 3 years
• Comprehensive Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, ST/LTD
• 401k with a match of 4% on first 5 %
• Onsite Gym

• 401k

jobs.title: Desktop Support Technician
jobs.description:
Desktop Technician II

The Desktop Services Technician II is responsible for troubleshooting and maintaining desktop computing environments used by AGCO employees and contractors...

This position is responsible for all aspects of incident managements including logging, analyzing, resolving, and follow up on hardware and software issues.

This includes installing, diagnosing, repairing, maintaining, and upgrading all hardware and equipment (including but not limited to desktops, laptops, thin clients, printers, scanners, copiers and smart phones) to ensure optimal workstation performance.

The person will also troubleshoot problem areas (in person, by telephone, or via remote access) in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end-user assistance where required This position is also responsible for providing Desktop Services to C-Level and SVP-Level positions.

Job Responsibilities

Diagnose and quickly resolve all Windows applications and networking problems reported to help minimize downtime Install, Upgrade, Support and troubleshoot Windows 10, Apple MacBook, Microsoft Office 2013/O365 and any other AGCO approved desktop application.

Follow AGCO's approved processes and procedures for Asset Management (Hardware and Software) Educate end users on basic software, hardware and peripheral device operation Document all support related activities in AGCO’s approved Service Desk application.

Mobile device support (smart phones and tablets) Provides site support and assistance to the Central IT Support Teams (Network, Storage, Telecom) as needed Troubleshoot and Support Audio and Video (A/V) technical issues in Conference Rooms, including Video Conference equipment.

Recommend suggestions, modifications, and additions to current standards for future modifications then communicate recommendations to Global Desktop Team.

Other duties as assigned by Management.

Minimum Requirements

Associate degree in related field 6-8 Years of experience in the field or related area.

Any of the following technical certifications: Microsoft Windows or higher certifications (MCP, MTA, MCSA, MCSE) Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and particular within a particular field.

Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds of equipment short distances

jobs.title: Infrastructure Architect / Azure Cloud WVD
jobs.description:
Job Description
The Infrastructure Consulting team designs, installs and configures enterprise technology architecture for Avanade clients. Its expertise spans security, availability/fail-over, operating system/compute, storage, database, networking, and operations infrastructure, typically involving Microsoft or multi-vendor technologies
...
As an Infrastructure Consultant with expertise in Endpoint Transformation/Modernization especially focusing on Windows Virtual Desktop (WVD), Citrix/VDI, and desktop/application publishing solutions (computers and mobile devices), you will participate in and sometimes lead the development of complex infrastructure solutions. You will work directly with clients to identify opportunities to transform their information technology landscapes and, as client business requirements change, help modify Avanade-designed infrastructure solutions. With a thorough understanding of both client and Avanade businesses, you will oversee people and project management for projects of moderate size and complexity. Day-to-day, you will:.

Execute large-scale desktop deployment, platform migration and mobile endpoint management. Partner with cross-functional technology and design teams to integrate technology, operations and solution requirements into solution strategies. Design and conduct systems integration testing, component integration testing and user acceptance testing.

Create project deliverable documentation, including design, build and operations guides About you You are a technologist with strong business skills. You are as comfortable working with a technical team as with client business users, and you know how to build bridges between the two. With your excellent communications skills, you are adept at mapping business needs to technology solutions and helping non-technical audiences understand the benefits of these solutions.

Your technical skillset likely includes:. Knowledge of several of the following areas: System Center Configuration Manager(SCCM), Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Endpoint Manager, Desktop Transformation, Operating System Deployment (OSD), Windows 10, Windows Virtual Desktop (WVD)/VDI, Non-Microsoft Mobility Management platforms (AirWatch etc),. Knowledge of operation management, systems security, testing, and mobility considerations.

Your non-technical experience likely includes:. Interacting with clients. Assisting in proposal writing and solutions.

Working with global teams and offshore resources. Communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both verbally and in written form. Technical and procedural documentation including designs.

You likely have at least three years of relevant experience and a Bachelor's Degree in computer science, computer engineering, management information systems or a related field. MCSA or MCSE certifications preferred..

3+ years' experience with System Center Configuration Management (SCCM) design/architecture and implementation experience is a must..

2+ years' experience with Intune (MDM/MAM-WE, etc.) and other mobility solutions is required..

3+ years' experience with transforming Windows Desktop operating systems within customer environments.

Experience of mobile device platforms, including Windows, Android, iOS and Knox is required. 2+ years' of Application & Desktop Virtualization technologies (Citrix/VMware/VDI/WVD). Experience with Windows Server/2016/2019, Active Directory, Windows 10 desktop transformation/desktop modernization.

1+ years' experience with Microsoft Azure, specifically Identity & Access Management (IAM), Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS), Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS). O365/M365 experience strongly preferred. PowerShell scripting. Application Packaging processes and technologies.

Operating System Deployment and Windows Image creation. Strong knowledge of Windows-as-a-Service. Windows Virtual Desktop (WVD) experience preferred..

Strong understanding of network protocols/services and network infrastructure. Strong technical troubleshooting and analytical skills Education: Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Business, Sales or Marketing strongly preferred. About Avanade: Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud services, business solutions and design-led experiences delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem.

Our professionals bring bold, fresh thinking combined with technology, business and industry expertise to help fuel transformation and growth for our clients and their customers. Avanade has 30,000 digitally connected people across 24 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. At Avanade, we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where our people can be the best at what they do.

We are proud be among leading organizations who are taking a stand for gender equity, both in and outside the workplace. This includes teaming with like-minded partners who are as passionate as we are about strengthening the role of women in the workplace, including Women in Technology International, Anita Borg Institute and Catalys Avanade requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. jobs.description: DescriptionThe Network Admin Specialist provides the highest level technical support as well as consultative service to the Mass General Brigham Information Systems (IS) departments, Medical Departments, and end user community in regards to system, infrastructure and application integration and interoperability. Responsibilities include planning and developing, elevated operational support for production systems, i.e., key business applications, network resources, securing Mass General Brigham enterprise environment. Principal Duties and Responsibilities Under direction of the Senior Manager, MGH/MGPO IS Planning and Management provides technical support to MVH in-house staff, user departments and vendors regarding all networked applications and systems. Enterprise Infrastructure Initiatives: The position will be responsible for working with the MVH leaderships and staffs in concert with MGB IS for initiatives such as desktop hardware and software upgrades, support of the voice... systems, and wired/wireless data infrastructure support and deployment. Departmental / Facilities / Real Estate Coordination: The incumbent will be responsible for working with the MVH leadership, MGB IS, MVH Facilities/Planning & Real Estate to facilitate the fit-out of new construction as well as renovations and back-fill renovations. This site position will participate in the purchase, provisioning, inventory, and support for the following “Low Voltage” systems which including Information Systems (applications, hardware, voice/data infrastructure), Biomedical Equipment, Audio Visual, Patient Entertainment/Educations, Telemedicine, Nurse Call, Security Systems, as well as various clinical systems. Tasks will include the implementation and support activities related to the above-mentioned Low Voltage systems or services at MVH adhering to MGB IS standards. This position may be included in all phases of the project life cycles including requirements gathering, business process design, documentation, quality assurance testing, training, implementation and ongoing support while working closely with MVH clinical and administrative department heads and staff. Responsible for the installation, maintenance and support of the PC network infrastructure, Voice Over IP phone systems, including onsite client and server hardware and software installation. Primary site liaison at the highest technical level to various MGB IS departments regarding process of network, desktop, voice systems, Intranet and application and biomedical device integration. Participate in the evaluation, testing, installation and configuration of new IS technologies and network based applications for site Clinical and Administrative Departments. Occasional after hours and weekend work to perform tasks that cannot be done during business hours. Primary on call responsible for site Low Voltage Systems and Technical Infrastructure. 24X7 responsibilities requiring on call and evening, night, weekend hours as needed. Performs other duties and special projects as assigned by Department Management. Qualifications BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience preferred. Certification in related field – Microsoft, Cisco, Citrix. Skills/Abilities/Competencies Required Great understanding of Operating Systems: Windows7, Windows10, Windows Server OS Expert knowledge of supported software: MS Office Suite, MS Internet Explorer Experience with Active Directory Administration, AGPM Understanding of typical network topologies, IP networking, and security Scripting Experience required, Application development background a plus Web technology knowledge System Center Configuration Manager Experience with application packaging, application distribution disciplines and techniques Experience with SQL, Oracle, and MS Access databases Excellent project management skills Independent and self-starter Ability to multitask and prioritize work requirements Excellent interpersonal, communication and customer service skills Test/ QA experience Experience of Epic applications not required but a plus

jobs.description:
OPPORTUNITY:

.NET WPF Developer...

About Us and Problem Definition

We are an industry leader in the development of Tax Preparation Software, with a large customer base of loyal tax professionals and a growing user base of consumer tax filers. As part of an overall re-platforming strategy, we are modernizing our flagship desktop-installed products.

Preserving core user experiences, while integrating modern technology stacks and capitalizing on the opportunities those frameworks present, is critical to our success.

Strategic Goals for a .NET WPF Developer
• Establish a strong foundation for building products using software development best practices
• Achieve high customer satisfaction by ensuring all product features are coded to user requirements
• Achieve high user adoption by effectively translating a highly proven user experience
• Extend testability of presentation technology, working with DevOps Engineers to integrate automated testing into release pipelines
• Work effectively as a member in our Scrum Agile process
• Participate in peer-reviews of software design and implementation
• Create clear and descriptive technical documentation for knowledge transfer

You should possess:
• A Bachelor s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related discipline
• 3+ years experience in desktop application development using the .NET Framework
• 3+ years experience working with C#/VB .NET with WPF and MVVM
• Working knowledge of Github & Azure DevOps a plus
• Effective communication skills, both written and verbal
• Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills

Work Location:

Multiple Locations in Western North Carolina, Nashville, TN and Virginia Beach, VA

Remote positions also available.

Associated topics: .net, application, back end, c++, develop, devops, java, php, software development engineer, software programmer
